The Mason Classical Academy in Naples: Florida, never adopted the Common Core standards in the first place, so any improvement in test results could not be attributed to abandoning Common Core.
In the subject of Mathematics: four public schools that did participate in Common Core ranked higher than the Mason Classical Academy, indicating that Common Core did not hinder their performance.
The conspiracy theorist website YourNews: com falsely claimed that the school's decision to abandon Common Core caused their test results to improve dramatically, spreading misinformation.
The principal of Mason Classical Academy: David Hull, clarified in 2014 that the school's focus was on providing a solid education rather than solely preparing students for state tests, indicating that their success was not solely dependent on standardized testing.
